#Text=Chiapas
#Text=Chiapas is a state in southern Mexico .
#Text=Chiapas is about as far south as you can get in Mexico .
#Text=It borders Guatemala on the southeast , the Pacific on the southwest , and the states of Oaxaca , Veracruz , and Tabasco from west to northeast .
#Text=Cities
#Text=– the state capital : large , hot , relatively modern ( Sam 's Club , Office Depot , Wal-Mart ) , and home to one of the world 's great zoos .
#Text=– a nice fishing village on the pacific coast of the state .
#Text=Cheap palapas available .
#Text=– the oldest Spanish city in Chiapas .
#Text=– surprisingly sophisticated .
#Text=– gateway to the Mayan ruins of Toniná
#Text=– also known as Jovel , 2,200m , beautiful , Mayan , lots of handicrafts , small ex-pat community .
#Text=–
#Text=Tsotsil indigenous village .
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=– Mayan ruins
#Text=– Mayan ruins

#Text=– Waterfall
#Text=– Waterfall
#Text=– Canyon and Reservoir ( includes Christmas Tree Falls )
#Text=– Ecotourism in the heart of the tallest mangroves in North America
#Text=Suggested reading
#Text=The Lawless Roads by Graham Greene .
#Text=Graham Greene describes his journey to San Cristobal de las Casas through Chiapas and Tabasco in the 1930s . ( )
#Text=The Power and the Glory by Graham Greene .
#Text=A whiskey priest , a corrupt church , and Chiapas all set in one of Greene 's most powerful books . ( )
#Text=Talk
#Text=Most people will speak Spanish , but this is less common among the indigenous peoples , where Tsotsil and Tseltal are the most common languages .
#Text=Very few who can speak English , almost always very badly .
#Text=Get in
#Text=It has a small international airport in the state capital , Tuxtla Gutiérrez , and is also connected by highways ( some are toll roads , or cuota ) with the surrounding states and Guatemala .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The easiest way to get around within cities is probably by private car , taxi , or colectivo .
#Text=Colectivos are small vans or buses that are very cheap and follow specific routes .
#Text=The main destinations on the route of each colectivo are listed on the right side of its windshield , though it is sometimes hard to tell if it is really going your way .
#Text=Asking the driver usually works , but do n't expect him or her to speak English .

#Text=Outside of cities , the best way to get around is by private car , bus ( slow , with frequent stops ) , colectivo ( a little more expensive than in the city ) , taxis , or pickups ( camionetas ) .
#Text=Taxis outside of cities charge very high rates if it is not their regular route , so make sure the driver knows you do not want a " viaje especial " ( special trip ) .
#Text=Sharing taxis is very common , and almost universal outside cities .
#Text=The pickups that are for public transportation are usually identifiable .
#Text=Try to get a seat in the cab , unless you enjoy being pressed against a large group of sweaty locals in the hot sun .
#Text=Pickups are also fairly slow and make frequent stops , but they are faster than the bus .
#Text=Volunteering

#Text=Volunteer as a Human Rights Observer in the autonomous Zapatista communities contact Capise ( brigadas@capise.org.mx ) for short ( 5 days ) activities or for longer volunteership contact Frayba .
#Text=Participate as a volunteer or group coordinator on sustainable projects in Maya communities .
#Text=The NGO NATATE A.C. focuses on the following fields : alternative technologies , waste management , water(capture and filtering ) , Education , reforestation , construction .
#Text=Opportunities are available for short and long term voluntary service .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Mole : Like happiness sauce .
#Text=Made from several or many varieties of chili peppers .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Pozol .
#Text=Chocolate/maize drink from Chiapas .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Like any other city and remote location in the world has its problem , but be aware of your personal belongings all the time , and do not walk with jewelry and expensive objects in sight .
#Text=Chiapas is usually in secure state , where the warmth of people will make you feel at home .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Oaxaca - 10 hours on the bus
#Text=Guatemala - About 10 hours to Guatemala City .
#Text=Tabasco -
#Text=Campeche - About 10 hours on the bus .
